markdown: Other County Health Services Item 8(a) LOS ANGELES COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF HOSPITALS PRESENT FUNCTIONS 1. Patient care: (a) inpatient, outpatient, clinic, extended care, long term and home care; (b) acute and non-acute care including diagnostic, therapeutical, rehabilitative and preventive care. 2. Specialized care for post polio, communicable diseases, mental health, emergency and trauma, chest, rehabilitation, tuberculosis, geriatric, alcoholic, extended care, chronic long term and similar specialized services. 3. Medical school training programs for medical students, in-terns and resident physicians, and direct training of nurses and allied paramedical personnel. 4. Research programs related to and supporting patient care services. 5. Non-hospital services: e.g., the Outside Medical Relief Program, the Home Health Care Program, the special East Los Angeles Childrens Clinic and the special Childrens Neurology and Teaching Programs. 6. Major new programs such as cardiac surgery, Renal Dialysis, kidney transplants, etc. 7. Contract programs for inpatient hospital and emergency hos-pital care and ambulance services. 8. Rehabilitation services to the chronically disabled indigent male with special emphasis on chronic alcoholism problems. 9. Ancillary services: professional medical social services; collections of revenue owed to the County; the Crippled Childrens Services program for Los Angeles County. PROSPECTS FOR THE FUTURE 1. Services not provided for by the private sector: e.g., alcoholism services, services for narcotics, psychiatric hospital services, communicable disease services, emergency and trauma services. 2. Major new types of programs such as the Heart, Cancer and Stroke Program, other regional medical care programs, etc. 3. Education and training for the development of present and future health manpower for the public and private health sectors. Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/phvd0227

PROSPECTS FOR THE FUTURE 1.
